data.text: @ScottGottliebMD @amazon Or you can get them for free from USPS.    Probably why Amazon has them on sale!
@ScottGottliebMD @amazon Can you put Paxlovid for sale on Amazon?
@ScottGottliebMD @amazon No thanks. Keep your tests, keep your mask, keep your vacs, keep your mandates. It needs to be OVER!
@Texas_WTF @AlbertoBarrera @ScottGottliebMD @amazon no arguments against.....simple pointing out the free kits for just  applying now for future use
@AlbertoBarrera @ablidy @ScottGottliebMD @amazon Also true. Although Iâ€™m not sure what the argument is against also offering the tests in the marketplace.
@AlbertoBarrera @Texas_WTF @ScottGottliebMD @amazon Therefore amazon is the convenient , best way way is not risk infection and getting boosted
@ScottGottliebMD @amazon More free rapid tests can now be ordered at https://t.co/rYzMBK3Ylc
@ScottGottliebMD @amazon these should be free, and why are you on here advertising for amazon? wait, I think we know why.

@Texas_WTF @ablidy @ScottGottliebMD @amazon If insured, you can get 8 tests per month covered by your insurance. Some even have partnerships so you can skip the reimbursement and just get them with no out of pocket cost from the pharmacy counter.
